definition: to deceive/to cheat/to hoodwink/to make a wild guess
Mongol ethnic group/abbr. for Mongolia 蒙古國|蒙古国[Meng3 gu3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Meng2]
to cover/ignorant/to suffer (misfortune)/to receive (a favor)/to cheat
to deceive/to cheat/to hoodwink/to make a wild guess
Mongol ethnic group/abbr. for Mongolia 蒙古國|蒙古国[Meng3 gu3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Meng2]
to cover/ignorant/to suffer (misfortune)/to receive (a favor)/to cheat

sentences.english: The sky glowed Saturday and a thin dusting of sand covered Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 北京周六天空灰蒙蒙的，到处是薄薄的扬沙尘土。

sentences.english: Both of the window screens were ashy, you would feel dim when looked out of window.
sentences.chinese: 两个窗纱也灰蒙蒙的，从宿舍向外看朦朦胧胧的感觉。

sentences.english: A grey sky, the test on the red Numbers, chilly wind.
sentences.chinese: 灰蒙蒙的天空，考试上鲜红的数字，清冷的风。
那时天空变得灰蒙蒙的。

sentences.english: We had gray skies and rain throughout our holiday.
sentences.chinese: 整个假期天空都灰蒙蒙的，阴雨连绵。

sentences.english: With less than a month to go until the start of the Beijing Olympics, the air in the Chinese capital remains gray and smoggy.
sentences.chinese: 离北京奥运不到一个月了，北京的空气仍然灰蒙蒙的。

sentences.english: A thick greyish mist was all round.
The afternoon was as grey as lead and cold.
sentences.chinese: 这是个灰蒙蒙冷飕飕的下午。

definition: (of mist, snow, floodwater etc) a vast expanse of whiteness
pitch-black/(fig.) to be completely in the dark
pitch-black/(fig.) to be completely in the dark
